page.title: 18LANDSCAPE QUARRIES MARKFIELD
page.content: HILL HOLE Hill Hole is a big disused quarry which is full of water. It is about 150 ft. deep and supposed to have a 6 ft. pike in it which many fishers have failed to catch. It has steps going down to a pump which pumps water into the quarry.Divers use it for practice but you are not supposed to swim in it.It is very dangerous. There are danger signs on Hill Lane but none on Hillside.Betty Pegg is a high rock beside the quarry. It was named after a woman named Betty Pegg who committed suicide from there. It is about 200 ft. high and rockclimbers use it for practice.Now the fishing season has started people go to fish there and in the brickyard by Ratby Lane.There is a doorway in the middle of the rock. I think it was a doorway for the workers when it was used.
